p: Solidago canadensis EO showed promising significant antifungal activity against M. fructicola and P. expansum in a dose dependent manner for both tested concentrations (1000 and 500 µg/mL). In particular, the tested concentration 1000 µg/mL was significantly higher than Azoxystrobin against M. fructicola. On the other hand, both tested concentrations were slightly lower than Azoxystrobin against P. expansum, whereas, a moderate activity was observed against A. niger only at 1000 µg/mL and was significantly lower than Azoxystrobin. No activity against B. cinerea for both tested concentrations was noted ( Figure 1).
